summary: Disney has tapped Academy Award-winner Barry Jenkins to direct a sequel to "The Lion King."
headline: 'The Lion King' sequel to be helmed by 'Moonlight' director Barry Jenkins

summary: Nikola's shares fell after CNBC reported new sex abuse allegations against founder Trevor Milton and General Motors said that it was still in discussions over a $2 billion deal with the electric truck maker, which was expected to close Wednesday.
headline: Nikola shares slide after second sexual abuse allegation raises questions about GM deal

summary: SpaceX's Starlink satellite internet network has been used in the field by Washington state emergency responders in recent weeks.
headline: Washington emergency responders first to use SpaceX's Starlink internet in the field: 'It's amazing'
Google's $310 million sexual harassment settlement aims to set new industry standards
summary: The company's settlement terms show gaps in the company's structure when it came to sexual harassment and retaliation.
Two months after Dell confirmed it was considering a spinoff, VMware's Pat Gelsinger weighs in on why that move could be beneficial.
headline: VMware CEO Pat Gelsinger says a Dell spinoff could give him freedom to work with more manufacturers

summary: J.P. Morgan settled a suit accusing the bank of "spoofing" trades in the silver futures market.  The suit was filed by hedge fund manager Daniel Shak and two commodity traders.
headline: J.P. Morgan settles lawsuit that accused firm of 'spoofing' precious metals markets trades

summary: When it is formally announced, the penalty will be a record for spoofing, which is when sophisticated traders flood markets with orders that they have no intention of actually executing.
headline: JPMorgan Chase to pay $920 million to resolve US investigations into trading practices

summary: Google's latest Android "choice screen" auction results show Microsoft's Bing was the main winner across most major European markets.
headline: Google's smaller rivals say it's not playing fair after record EU antitrust fine
How Amazon managed the coronavirus crisis and came out stronger
summary: Amazon reported record profits during the pandemic, but it didn't get there without navigating a slew of challenges.
The libertarian-leaning political advocacy group backed by billionaire Charles Koch has seen key policy victories under President Donald Trump, including regulatory and tax cuts.
headline: Despite policy wins under Trump, the Koch network isn't helping the president's reelection bid
Coca-Cola partners with Molson Coors for U.S. launch of Topo Chico Hard Seltzer
summary: To bring its Topo Chico Hard Seltzer to the United States next year, Coca-Cola is partnering with Molson Coors Beverage.
In 2019, JPMorgan Chase announced a $10 billion commitment to women small business owners. To date, the bank says it has already reached the halfway mark of that goal.
headline: JPMorgan lent $5 billion to women entrepreneurs over the last year, halfway to its $10 billion commitment
Op-ed: Don't let the future of work be defined by more hours and meetings
summary: Coronavirus remote work has increases employee hours and meetings. This will be the future of our jobs, unless we take steps now to fix it.

headline: Biden campaign slams Facebook for 'regression' in its efforts to safeguard the election
summary: Biden's campaign manager accused Facebook of failing to act by its commitments to prohibit messages misrepresenting who can vote and how.

headline: Disney+ now lets you watch movies with friends no matter where you are
summary: The "GroupWatch" feature allows a user to invite up to six other subscribers to watch together. Each user has the ability to pause, play, rewind or fast forward for the whole group, keeping everyone connected.

headline: Cramer blasts Congress for failing to pass more stimulus: 'They hated each other and they blew it'
summary: CNBC's Jim Cramer took aim at the federal government's failure to pass a second coronavirus stimulus relief bill to aid ailing small businesses.

headline: Retail trade group tells consumers this holiday season to shop 'safe and early'
summary: The retail industry's leading trade group has a message to customers ahead of the 2020 holiday season, which will be unlike any other: Get your shopping done early in order to stay safe during the coronavirus pandemic.
The former FDA chief urged Americans to adhere to public health measures as the U.S. enters the fall and winter.
headline: Dr. Scott Gottlieb fears U.S. headed for 'most dangerous season' for coronavirus infections

summary: One survey found that almost 40% of parents who didn't plan to apply for federal financial aid, now say they will as a result of Covid-19 pandemic.
headline: The FAFSA opens October 1—and it's more important than ever to complete it ASAP

summary: The palm-scanning technology, called Amazon One, connects shoppers' palm to a credit card to let them pay without waiting in line.
headline: Amazon unveils a way to pay with your palm in stores
